moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 e6: Block propably hoping for Nimzo-Indian... Anyway, nothing special yet
moves.3... d5:
Or a transition into declined Queens gambit...
Still very common opening
moves.4. cxd5 exd5 5. d4 Bb4 6. Bg2 Nc6: And "White's behind in developement", caused by fianchetto
moves.7. Bd2:
Missing that the pawn on D4 will fall, anyway there was not need to hurry with the Bishop...
E3 would have been possible although Blacks building up preassure with twotimes the Bishop/Knight combination.
moves.7... Nxd4 8. e3: Bit too late. A3 would have probably had the same effect, after exchanging the dark squared Bishop with the white Knight.
moves.8... Nc6 9. Nge2 O-O 10. O-O Be6: And it's looking very good for Black. Better development, one pawn advantage. Allthough I'm not sure what the meaning of this turn was...
moves.11... Ba5 12. b4 Bb6: without success, but at least a bit of the queenside preassure was reduced
moves.13. Na4: Trying to get at least the minor imbalances/the pair of Bishops (actually, this will turn out to be important :D)
moves.13... Re8 14. Nxb6 cxb6 15. Nf4: Now the fight for the Center can begin ;)
moves.15... Qd7 16. Bc3: Trying to weaken the pawn structure and reduce Blacks king safety, but Black is of course aware of that...
moves.16... Ne4: Since D5 is the central of the Struggle, the only possible move.
moves.17. Nxe6: Getting rid of another Bishop. Knights vs Bishops. Actually not ideal for me, since we're struggling for one point....
moves.17... Nxc3: Actually I totally missed this possibility... A solid move...
moves.18... Ne2+ 19. Kh1: ?, at least thats what Rybka is saying.
moves.20... Qxe6: ?? Allowing BxD5 and the struggle ends. Additionally threat of BxF7
moves.25... Ne7 26. Rf2: Trying to exchange the Rooks. Would have made clear where we are heading to.
moves.28... h5 29. Kf2 a6 30. h4 Nc6 31. Re3 R: Both sides seam to loose concentration :D
moves.48. Rxf4 Ne3 49. Re4 Nc4 50. Kh4 Nxa3 51: And black resigned, seein the mate in 1... :)
